WRITING.TEXT: Wafford is going to be a handfull for any team in the future. He's quick, strong, and nimble. He's going to be a major factor going forward. The Bronco D constantly over pursued plays and were out of postion throughout the reason. But some how the opposing team (including the Raiders) would bail them out. The Raiders should of beat them twice. Case in point where Cooper beats Roby and Ward goes for the big hit and Cooper rolls for another 10 yards. The Broncos have holes on D and the Raiders have the weapons to expose them.
Yea i was wondering why the cover 2 as well.
He basically had to hold or that was going to be a touchdown. The middle was wide open. I wonder if they saw that and attacked it again on the throw to Roberts
Thanks for the advice! I'm kinda leaning towards one of the corner areas.

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for some seat advice for a first timer.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm FINALLY making my pilgrimage to the motherland from Denver for the Colts game. I'm looking at seats and I'm wondering where are the best views inside the Colosseum. Any suggestions?

Ouch! That dude has been a warrior for us. That guy bleeds silver and black. You probably don't appreciate guys like wheatly, Kaufman, and fargus either. He could of left whenever he wanted but stayed bc he's a raider.
God damn it Jason Campbell. What could of been....
What's the stictching/quality like compared to buying at a retail store. One of those Bojaxs jersey may have my name on it.

I knew our draft was better than the donkeys. I really like this numerical approach to analyzing a draft class. I was going to start pulling hair out if I had to read another lazy draft analysis that graded us lower bc we didn't draft a true MLB.
I'm incredibly disturbed by this piece. Fuck this guy and fuck deadspin.
